discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
"When you opt out, your company no longer contributes to the improvement of the normalization process. You still receive content updates, but the updates may be less applicable because they aren't informed by your company's unique software installation footprint that exists within your environment and CMDB."

Selected Answer: B
Page 112 of Vancouver text

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
b is correct
it's B https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/c_SAMContentService.html

choices.D: Customer doesn't receive Content Library updates
choices.B: Unrecognized data doesn't get sent to the ServiceNow Content Service
choices.C: Unrecognized data is sent to the ServiceNow Content Service, but is now encrypted
choices.A: Unrecognized data doesn't get sent to the ServiceNow Content Service and the customer doesn't receive Content Library updates

questions.question_text: What is the impact of a customer opting out of the ServiceNow Content Service for specific models?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
alm_asset is the base class for asset
There is no cmdb_asset table available. Verified on a PDI.

Selected Answer: C
Page 402 of HAM Fundamentals - Vancouver:

The base asset class is alm_asset.

Selected Answer: C
In Now Learning: Extend Asset and Configuration Management > Asset Classes:
To create a new asset class, a new table is created that extends the base asset table (alm_asset).

When creating a model category, the Asset Class field gives alm_asset and alm_hardware as options along with alm_facility, alm_consumable, alm_license. Shouldn't alm_asset then be the base asset class?

Selected Answer: B
B
The default asset classes are Hardware, Software License, and Consumable. These general classes can be used to manage various assets.
From the options the table that represents base asset class is Hardware [alm_hardware] Stores general, financial, and contractual information about hardware assets.

Selected Answer: C
Verified via Docs: 

https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-it-asset-management/page/product/asset-management/reference/r_InstalledWithAssetManagement.html

questions.question_text: Classes are represented as tables in the ServiceNow database. Which is the base asset class?
Which view displays metrics to the user to indicate when they are due for a refresh based on the scheduled retirement of their assets?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D
My Assets homepage

Self-Service > My Assets displays an overview of assets specific to the logged-in user, including requests and assigned assets, entitled software, and metrics that indicate when the user is due for a refresh based on the scheduled retirement of their assets.

Selected Answer: D
My Assets provides this information

Selected Answer: BD
Definitely B and D, see docs extract below:

There are two restocking options:

An email can be sent to the stockroom manager (user identified in the Manager field on the stockroom record) to place a vendor order. A task is automatically created for the stockroom manager or, if Procurement is active, purchase order and a purchase order line item are created.
A transfer order can be generated automatically to restock the item from another stockroom.

Selected Answer: BD
Marka's text from page 372 HAMF Vancouver

Selected Answer: BD
BD
The two automatic restocking actions are:
Create a task assigned to the stockroom manager to create a purchase order; an email is sent to the stockroom manager notifying them of the task
Create a transfer order to restock from another stockroom

choices.B: Create a task assigned to the stock room manage to create a purchase order
choices.D: Create a transfer order to restock from another stockroom
choices.E: Create a transfer order to restock from a vendor
choices.C: Create a new asset from any returned inventory
choices.A: Create a task assigned to stock room manager to contact procurement manager

questions.question_text: Which of these automatic restocking actions are available in baseline? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
vendor catalog

Selected Answer: D
Answer: D. Vendor Catalog

Explanation: "The vendor catalog is a list of goods available from different vendors."

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/product-catalog/concept/c_ManageVendorCatalogItems.html

Selected Answer: D
D
To source a request by purchasing it, select Add Purchase Order. With Vendor catalog Items created, you can select the vendor from whom you wish to purchase. The pull-down displays the vendors and their current price for the items.

Selected Answer: D
Vendor catalog

questions.question_text: When sourcing a requested item from a supplier using the catalog task form to create a purchase order, the catalog item must be available in:
